subject: History
title: The Great Depression Goes Global
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Great Depression Goes Global.

hook.text: A stock market crash in New York in 1929 sent shockwaves around the worldâ€”and helped start World War II.

buildup.text: American banks collapsed, recalled foreign loans, and world trade fell 65%. Millions lost jobs across every continent.

discovery.text: Germany, dependent on American loans, was hit hardest. Unemployment reached six million by 1932.

twist.text: Democratic governments seemed helpless. Voters turned to strongmen: Hitler in Germany, militarists in Japan, Mussolini.

climax.text: The Depression proved that economic collapse could topple democracies and empower dictators to start wars.

punchline.text: A financial crash became a world war.

quiz.question: How did the Great Depression contribute to the rise of dictatorships?
options: It forced democratic nations to increase military spending
Economic collapse made voters turn to extremist leaders who promised order
It caused a food shortage that only dictators could solve
